snippet: Some 39 percent now say they approve of the way the president is handling the economy, and 55 percent say they disapprove.
abstract: New York Times/CBS News Poll of registered voters finds 39 percent approve of the way Pres Obama is handling the economy, and 55 percent say they disapprove; April poll found 44 percent approved and 48 percent disapproved; declining confidence in the economy seems to be the most powerful force influencing voters, undercutting key areas of support for Obama and helping give Republican challenger Mitt Romney an advantage.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and MARJORIE CONNELLY
byline.contributor: Marina Stefan and Dalia Sussman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Some 39 percent now say they approve of the way the president is handling the economy, and 55 percent say they disapprove.

headline.main: Economic Fears Hurting Obama, Poll Indicates
headline.print_headline: Economic Fears Hurting Obama, Poll Indicates
